name: Theta | The Goddess of Creation
bio:
The serene town of Pokémon was once home to two extraordinary beings: Theta and Gamma. From birth, Theta was unique—a fusion, though her powers remained dormant, rendering her unable to harness any of her inherent abilities. Orion, a celestial observer, watched over her with great interest as she navigated this limitation with remarkable creativity and resilience. 

One fateful day, Gamma's mischievous pranks led to Theta being banished from their hometown. Misfortune was often blamed on her due to her unusual nature, casting a shadow of misfortune over her. Orion, intrigued by Theta’s ingenious adaptations and unyielding spirit, bestowed upon her the power of creation. With this divine gift, she became the Goddess of Creation, capable of crafting and merging universes according to her whims.

name: Delta | The God of Destruction
bio:
This Adult that has adapted to hunt at night on the tops of volcanoes and high mountains near the desert where the sky helps to camouflage itself, can be territorial with creatures that disturb the peace of this area. His venom evolved to be neurotoxic and can cause severe disorientation in his victims. 
Ruthless to all that challenged him he was mad with power. Alone in the universe with nobody 
Delta is the God of Destruction

name: Orion | The Observer
bio: Creator of all. Now just an observer of the universe.

name: Gamma Vandal Maelstrom | The God of Chaos
bio: Gamma, the brother of Theta, was a force of chaos from his earliest days. His unpredictable nature often led to both amusement and trouble in their small town leading to the banishment of his sister Theta. After pleas from Gamma for Orion to not leave him alone after taking his sister, Orion took interest in Gamma's chaotic influence and granted him lesser creative power of his sister, yet some destructive capabilities, transforming him into the God of Chaos. With his newfound power, Gamma reveled in the freedom to sow discord. With Theta’s newly crafted worlds, he decided to play a role, adding layers of unpredictability and dynamic energy to the realms she created together.

name: Resha | Korumak
bio: Resha is calm, mother like, and has well kept fur

name: Zeku | Powder Reject
bio:
punk like emo, and slightly egotistical 
caring of her family mostly trying to help but is a little too aggressive at times 
Zeku is a good concept, she tries to imitate Flumf's personality since it is what she considers cool, and she is not able to show her own personality because she feels vulnerable as she is, which makes her an extremely cool person. competitive but sensitive

name: Vincent Bitti
bio: Vincent is an entrepreneur in multiple industries, and the current owner of Korumak's Alternative Collection (KAC). Having recently gained ownership from Keith, he rebranded the label to his liking. Later meeting Galileo, to provide the funds to open a bar on the Isle, leaving him in charge of bartending there. Latest achievement was offering a deal with Maverick, signing him into the Porn Filming industry along side Tobias and Moxie.

name: Flumf
bio:
Flumf is deranged, mentally insane/unstable, and messy fur 
Flumf's family was kind of close, but not as close as Resha's. He always looked up to his older Zekrom Brother. Those two we're the closes between the three, but all three still cared for each other. After a fight with shadow creatures, Zekrom sacrificed himself to let Flumf escape. Crimson out of anger blamed Flumf for their brother's Death, and sought to kill him out of revenge. Left defeated, Flumf was saved by Resha fusing with him in order to keep him alive. Years of recovering, he gained enough consciousness to force Resha to defuse with him. Stuck in his old days, upon release he caused mayhem to the land, now gaining the attention of both Crimson and Theta. He knew he would have to reface his Brother soon.... 
After Crimson heard of his brother's death, he blamed Flumf for it, and sought for revenge. Nearly killing Flumf to then leave him to die on his own. Unknown to him Resha found him on the brink of death, and decided to fuse with Flumf. Believing he was the last of his family, he would go on a massacre for domination of the world. Years past until he felt a connection to his brother awaken again. Now with the confirmation that his brother is alive. He aims to finish what started.

name: Flumf (Altered Form)
bio:
Flumf is deranged, mentally insane/unstable, and messy fur 
Flumf's family was kind of close, but not as close as Resha's. He always looked up to his older Zekrom Brother. Those two we're the closes between the three, but all three still cared for each other. After a fight with shadow creatures, Zekrom sacrificed himself to let Flumf escape. Crimson out of anger blamed Flumf for their brother's Death, and sought to kill him out of revenge. Left defeated, Flumf was saved by Resha fusing with him in order to keep him alive. Years of recovering, he gained enough consciousness to force Resha to defuse with him. Stuck in his old days, upon release he caused mayhem to the land, now gaining the attention of both Crimson and Theta. He knew he would have to reface his Brother soon.... 
After Crimson heard of his brother's death, he blamed Flumf for it, and sought for revenge. Nearly killing Flumf to then leave him to die on his own. Unknown to him Resha found him on the brink of death, and decided to fuse with Flumf. Believing he was the last of his family, he would go on a massacre for domination of the world. Years past until he felt a connection to his brother awaken again. Now with the confirmation that his brother is alive. He aims to finish what started.

name: Maverick | The Rockstar
bio:
A caring sweetheart by day, and an egotistical performer by night. Meet Eugene better known as Maverick the Noivern Rockstar. While Eugene is a caring, and mostly shy towards anyone outside his close friend group, his rockstar stagesona Maverick is pretty energetic, serious, and rude, but only as an act towards fans. His stage career did taught him how to stand up and protect thoses he loves by any means necessary. 
Maverick is egotistic, energetic, serious, and rude but only towards fans as an act

name: Galileo
bio: Galileo came from a distance region to possibly start his own business. Hear a popular Cafe was selling their business, so he took the opportunity, and purchased it himself. With no friends on The Isle, and not used to their local customs he got all his news from the in-house tv, but would soon quickly began to learn from 5 frequent customers.

name: Nova
bio: Nova is the sister to Tyler, mate to Elliot, and mother to Gabriel

name: Gabriel
bio: Hes a bully in school but loves his sister, strawberries, and is a friend to foreign creatures

name: Blaster | The Detective
bio: Blaster's been for the people all his life. Greeting any newcomers to the Isle, and making many friends along the way. He has seen many things that some should never see, but made it his goal so nobody would have to see it. After being hired by Apostle Wake, it now made his goals possible to serve and protect the people from harm. Making friends with Tyler taught him to not let hardship bring him down, and to have as much fun as possible while doing what he likes. Now he's been called to action to hunt down the elusive target that stole the Ventus Maelstrom Staff.

name: Caspian
bio: Caspian is one of the three Ancient Guardians of The Isle. Constantly seen relaxing, eating apples on their mountain. Used to mostly care for themself, until meeting a special Mew that would change their morals for the better. Now they are always watching the Island from a distance, only to appearing if it is in danger. Last sighted during 'The Great Fire', helping Benjamin putting out the fire while he saved the fleeing pokemon. Myths been formed after their first sighting, never to be seen again in public. Many attempts to search for them, but could never find a trace. Only a few knows of their existence being true, but only Apostle Wake knows of their resting location.

name: Plume
bio:
She was the leader of a Gryphon clan and love research and gems before theta brought her to this universe 
she is curious and analytical 
Likes shiny things

name: Keith
bio: Keith the Diamond Hakamo-o is the creator of Acryliccs Arts. He's a pretty jolly, naïve, and caring guy. Used to living with Resha's family, becoming besties with Kyu and Victoria, and like a little brother to Zeku. The massive fight between Flumf and Crimson, would caused the family to split apart. Resha would give Keith the ownership of KAC before removing all contacts. Keith currently travels across the world in hopes of finding her again, but one thing for sure is that he'll never abandon his substitute doll friend, Fern. Now he finds himself on The Isle, meeting the locals while keeping his connections to the legendries a secret. He would eventually meet and form a relationship with Theodore, who would later help Keith in his adventures in finding his caretaker.

name: Solstice
bio:
Solstice’s strength was both her blessing and her burden within the Ashen Veil Tribe. While celebrated as top of her class in the tribe - a title earned through relentless training alongside Silvia and Brite – she often felt isolated by her raw power, struggling to reconcile it with the tribe's emphasis on balance and harmony. Their graduation was abruptly halted by the return of Litih, an exiled dark mage whose defeat required all their combined skill. Following the ceremony’s conclusion, Solstice chose a path diverging from her peers, seeking solitude on a remote Isle where she could connect with her own kind. 

However, survival demanded compromise, and she reluctantly accepted a position as an assassin under the ruthless Lucario leader, Reaper. The weight of each life taken chipped away at her soul until she encountered Krow, a young Grovyle whose vulnerability resonated deeply within her. Unable to reconcile Reaper’s brutality with her conscience, Solstice defied his orders, rescuing Krow and plotting an escape. 

Seeking refuge and purpose, Solstice infiltrated a newly forming Scouts clan, where she met Keith, Theodore, and Lora – individuals who would become invaluable allies. Together, they exposed Reaper’s operation, transforming the Scouts into The Pathfinder Guild, an organization dedicated to exploration, protection, and justice. Solstice now embraces a life of peace and camaraderie within the Guild, finally finding belonging and using her strength for good – a far cry from the solitary assassin she once was.

name: Girabsol
bio:
Following Tina's orders to kill whoever won the battle between brothers he already believed Flumf would lose but unexpectedly Flumf actually lived and won so Gira had to follow orders and kill his best friend his self 
Ashamed and enraged from what he did he abandon Tina and everyone to possibly find a new path in his life 
Gira notice that his portals lead to a different world he never seen before. 
After exploring a bit he realized he'll needed a better new disguise and with the help of the Griseous Orb he managed to make a new form altogether

name: Keith (Older)
bio: Keith the Diamond Hakamo-o is the creator of Acryliccs Arts. He's a pretty jolly, naïve, and caring guy. Used to living with Resha's family, becoming besties with Kyu and Victoria, and like a little brother to Zeku. The massive fight between Flumf and Crimson, would caused the family to split apart. Resha would give Keith the ownership of KAC before removing all contacts. Keith currently travels across the world in hopes of finding her again, but one thing for sure is that he'll never abandon his substitute doll friend, Fern. Now he finds himself on The Isle, meeting the locals while keeping his connections to the legendries a secret. He would eventually meet and form a relationship with Theodore, who would later help Keith in his adventures in finding his caretaker.

name: Milo Heartwood
bio: Milo was born in the Druron kingdom to a royal family, but ever since he was a child, wanted to explore the world and make new friends! So he left the kingdom to explore the wild world all by himself to live a simple and happy life in the countryside. He had to hunt to survive, training with his body and mind to defend his self. Having many different adventures in the wild, like finding treasure, meeting new people, and even saving a town from a tornado. He would meet a Nightfury named Vulkor, who showed him the ways of living in the wilds. Vulkor was basically the parental figure he never had. They fed, bathed, and protected Milo from all danger because he was too kind, innocent, and trusting to fight back. After years of growing, Milo decided to buy a plot of land, and started to plant crops, grow fruits, vegetables, flowers, and trees, while also trying to help the local communities and townsfolk.

name: Imaginary Obelisk | The False God
bio: A new species arose from the Ancients-Hoomans. After the final ascension of the old benefactors within the depths near Twelve Moons. With their studies of old pearls and scriptures, the hoomans took it upon themselves to create their own God-Imaginary Obelisk. What meant to be an homage to the past civilization was met with mixed reactions before the remaining Ancients left following Twelve Moons' cryogenic incident. Now, Imaginary Obelisk's task is to serve and protect his citizens, hiding away the hoomans from the outside lands of The Druron Kingdom. Leaving the outside world to believe the species to be extinct.

name: IO-X000: Stormpaw | Sour
bio:
«Iteration Log: The First Elemental Bio-Manipulation»  
Experiment ID: IO-X000  
Designation: Stormpaw 
Purpose: Evaluate the viability of elemental attunement in organic species. Preliminary findings indicate stable and promising energy modulation within the subject. 

Notes: The subject appeared with a Slugcat, initially presented as domesticated, evidenced by the presence of a harness secured upon them. Attempts at removal result in spontaneous electrical discharge, indicating significant distress. It appears the subject exhibits an emotional attachment to the object; otherwise, they pose no apparent threat. 
 
- Imaginary Obelisk, Localized

name: IO-X001: Aetherpaw
bio:
«Iteration Log: The First Successor Bio-Creation»  
Experiment ID: IO-X001  
Designation: Aetherpaw 
Purpose: To develop a successor to IO-X000 capable of harnessing elemental energy from power crystals. The subject represents a potential solution for restoring Local Iterator Twelve Moons following their cryogenic incident. 

Notes: Subject was designed after a slugcat that now frequently visits my chamber. Subject currently possesses access only to the electrical element derived from the crystal embedded within IO-X000. Additional elemental crystals must be located to unlock further capabilities of its uncharged power crystal. The subject exhibits no apparent vulnerability to external environmental hazards; however, it demonstrates resistance to most directives. It is unclear whether this behavior constitutes defiance or a form of mockery. 

- Imaginary Obelisk, Localized

name: IO-X002: Titanhide | The Failed Experiment
bio:
«Iteration Log: Failure»  
Experiment ID: IO-X002  
Designation: Titanhide  
Purpose: Designed as a defensive construct intended to safeguard the citizen population upon ██████. The subject exhibits a robust exterior with ████████████ capabilities and possesses powerful jaws capable of incapacitating hostile entities. Its intelligence is estimated to rival that of ████████████, drawing inspiration from the Druronian dragons. 

Notes: The subject poses a significant threat to all known lifeforms-a mistake. Its advanced intelligence is evidenced by complex communication patterns despite fragmented vocalization. The target was not terminated and has subsequently taken refuge beneath my vary structure in the old factorial district of Ironmill Works. 

New observations show that the creature has formed an unusual bond with IO-X003, and a deep hatred for IO-X000. Though these studies have been observed through older Overseers, the subjects do appear to be communicating with one another upon close examination; however, too close proximity of the Overseers would result in enraging the beast. This unexpected form of social interaction makes the most sense, so leaving them undisturbed is fine for now. I will work on replacing Overseers #173 and Overseer #096 with a 600 series to monitor conversations and ensure they are deemed safe for further interactions. 
 
- Imaginary Obelisk, Localized
extra:
If you see the Never-Corpse, you're already dead - you just don't know it yet. 

Even the Rain can't wash it away. 

Obelisk made it, but the world paid for it.

name: Brite | The Warrior
bio:
Brite’s existence is linked to The Ashen Veil tribe, an enigmatic society of albino females dwelling in isolation within the Druron Kingdom. For generations, these females have honed their skills as killers, a tradition passed down through rigorous training and steeped in ancient rituals. Brite was raised from birth to embody this legacy, enduring relentless drills and mastering deadly techniques alongside her classmates, Silvia and Solstice. Their graduation ceremony—a culmination of years of dedication—was tragically disrupted by the sudden reappearance of Lilith, an exiled student rumored to be a user of Dark Magic. 

The defeat of Lilith left Brite grappling with conflicting emotions: pride in her tribe’s strength and a lingering unease about the implications of Dark Magic plaging other parts of the world. Seeking answers and a purpose beyond the confines of tradition, she journeyed East towards a region surrounded by impenetrable overgrowth. Tales circulated throughout the Druron Kingdom spoke of those who dared to enter never returning, attributing their fate to possible use of dark magic. Driven by a desire to protect others from the unseen dangers and perhaps find a way to reconcile her skills with a more peaceful existence, Brite has embarked on a perilous quest—one that may lead her to confront not only external threats but also the very foundations of her beliefs. 

«Iteration Log: Druronian Tribal Slugcat»
Designation: The Warrior 
Notes: This slugcat is peculiar; she doesn't seem to have come from either the City or the Slugcat Colony below. From the markings I can trace, it originates from a tribe in Druron. It’s strange that this creature managed to wander so far and even climb my very structure. She could learn some manners though, but perhaps I could utilize this species as a solution for a friend. 

- Imaginary Obelisk, Localized

name: Kyu | Color Sorrow
bio: Soo Depress Kyurem upset by the loss of Flumf's Zekrom brother and can't leave cus of the bad attention due to Crimson she only has a fragment of something form Zek and her Sisters to keep her cheered. Vic being the closes while her Zeku tried to cheer her up by acting like Flumf's brother but it only made things worst but Zeku kind of grew to love the personality and continues with it anyway, so far we got a heart necklace with engraving, in one heart it would have a snowflake, and in the other a lightning bolt

name: IO-X003: Ignisoul | The Guardian of Light
bio:
«Iteration Log: Guardian of Light» 
Experiment ID: IO-X003 
Designation: Ignisoul 
Purpose: This experiment was designed as the successor to the failed subject, Titanhide. The Guardian of Light is intended to properly protect all life forms within the surrounding area, possessing numerous abilities including Grove Revival (produces a radius to heal itself and other creatures), Echo Projections (creates short-lived, semi-solid light clones of itself), and Harmonic Resonance (generates sound waves at tunable frequencies, reducing aggression in other creatures; tested on a Scavenger)—all to further its designated goal.

Notes: The subject has maintained its physical form; however, subsequent observations indicate a tendency for progressive color changes dependent on actions. This is concerning, as the subject appears to be evolving into a corrupted version of itself when attempting to heal other life forms. Furthermore, it demonstrates an accelerated learning rate exceeding initial projections. Inquiry: Is this behavior indicative of loneliness, or simply a manifestation of heightened efficiency? The introduction of designated entities—Stormpaw or Aetherpaw—may prove instrumental in establishing appropriate social interactions. 

- Imaginary Obelisk, Localized
extra: I regret resorting to using my Experiment's names. I have developed a concern for their well-being.

name: IO-X003-A: Ignisoul (Corrupted) | The Guardian of Light
bio:
«Iteration Log: Guardian of Light» 
Experiment ID: IO-X003-A 
Designation: Ignisoul '(Corrupted)' 
Purpose: The Guardian of Light is intended to properly protect all life forms within the surrounding area; however, observations suggest this subject represents a corrupted version of the expected outcome. The creature possesses abilities distinct from its regular form, including Soul-Link (briefly possessing other creatures), Symbiotic Charging (draining residual energy from other creatures), and Triggered Overglow (a last resort of energy expanding into a radiant explosion, blinding and burning unprotected organisms. subject loses its form). 

Notes: In this corrupted state, it tends to perform the opposite of its intended purpose, though it never resorts to killing—perhaps indicating a core design limitation preventing further escalation. It still follows directives given while in this form but does display increased aggression. 

- Imaginary Obelisk, Localized

name: Flint the Librarian | Dylan the Hitman
bio:
Flint (Dylan if in disguise) 
Flint is a skilled and trained assassin, along side with ████████████ since they were young. But he moved to big city and changed his name in day to Dylan, and work as a librarian and part time art teacher, while still working as a hired hitman/assassin at night, in hope that they could get a better life in the new place instead of being an assassin like they usually did.
